cells.data:
Lower Bounds

- Simpler model; no loops in code, just branches--large decision tree
- Prove a lower bound on the number of decision trees/number of comparisons
- Any other program using the same comparison/decision idea can be reduced to this model and therefore the "best" or "minimum" runtime is bounded by the number of decision trees

Comparison based sorts: $\Omega(n\lg{n})$
Non-comparison based sorts??

- Counting for integer keys $\in [0 \dots k]$
- Radix based on fixed "digits"
- Bucket for random keys

Heap Sort

cf. Implementation in Java from 410 & PPT
